valuesPreferenceDescription.value: Shows values on graph axes, reference line, "Slope of Tangent", and "Net Signed Area".

predictPreferenceDescription.value: Adds a mode that allows you to predict f of {{variable}}.

widthPattern.value: Right now, {$shape} shape with width {$width} chosen. {$curveSentence}

controlArea.value: Reset the sim to start over.

screenButtonsHelpText.value: Manipulate a graph and explore its derivative curve in real time.

playArea.value:
There is an interactive curve in the Primary Graph Area representing the graph of f and a 
non-interactive curve representing the derivative of f. You can choose different shapes to
add to curve in Primary Graph Area at any point. There are Exploration Tools allowing flexible
investigation of all curves with {$variable} coordinates aligned.

interactionHint.value:
Choose Shape to add to curve in Primary Graph Area. Use Exploration Tools to investigate steepness
of f curve at different points.

screenButtonsHelpText.value: Manipulate a graph and explore its integral curve in real time.

playArea.value:
There is an interactive curve in the Primary Graph Area representing the graph of f and a
non interactive curve representing the integral of f. You can choose different shapes to add to
curve in Primary Graph Area at any point. There are Exploration Tools allowing flexible
investigation of all curves with {$variable} coordinates aligned.

interactionHint.value:
Choose Shape to add to curve in Primary Graph Area. Use Exploration Tools to investigate
net signed area under f curve bounded by horizontal axis and f of {$variable} starting from left.

screenButtonsHelpText.value:
Manipulate a graph and explore its derivative and integral curves in real time,
with or without discontinuities.

playArea.value:
There is an interactive curve in the Primary Graph Area representing the graph of f and
non interactive curves in other Graph Areas. You can choose different shapes and widths to
add to curve in Primary Graph Area at any point. You can change which set of two Graph Areas
are viewable: Integral and Primary or Primary and Derivative. There are Exploration Tools
allowing flexible investigation of all viewable curves with {$variable} coordinates aligned.

interactionHint.value:
Choose Shape to add to curve in Primary Graph Area. Use Exploration Tools to explore
relationships between graphs in viewable graph set.

screenButtonsHelpText.value:
Manipulate a graph and explore its integral, derivative, and second derivative curves in 
real time, with or without discontinuities.

playArea.value:
There is an interactive curve in the Primary Graph Area representing the graph of f and
non interactive curves in other Graphs Areas. You can choose different shapes and widths to
add to curve in Primary Graph Area at any point. You can change which set of three Graph Areas
are viewable: Integral, Primary, and Derivative, or Primary, Derivative, and 
Second Derivative. There are Exploration Tools allowing flexible investigation of all curves
with {$variable} coordinates aligned.

interactionHint.value:
Choose Shape to add to curve in Primary Graph Area. Use Exploration Tools to explore
relationships between graphs in viewable graph set.

accessibleHelpTextCollapsed.value: Explore slope of line tangent to f at {$variable} coordinate of Tangent tool.

zero.value: At {$variable} equals {$x}, slope of line tangent to f is zero.

positive.value: At {$variable} equals {$x}, slope of line tangent to f is positive {$absoluteSlope}.

negative.value: At {$variable} equals {$x}, slope of line tangent to f is negative {$absoluteSlope}.

accessibleHelpTextCollapsed.value: Explore net signed area under f curve between {$variable} equals 0 and current {$variable} coordinate of Area Under Curve tool.

zero.value: Net signed area under f curve is zero between {$variable} equals 0 and {$x}.

positive.value: Net signed area under f curve is positive {$absoluteArea} between {$variable} equals 0 and {$x}.

negative.value: Net signed area under f curve is negative {$absoluteArea} between {$variable} equals 0 and {$x}.

accessibleHelpText.value: Add or remove Tangent Tool.
Add or remove Reference Line.
Add or remove Area Under Curve Tool and shading under curve bounded by horizontal axis and f.
Show or hide coordinate grid on all graphs.
Show or hide f of {$variable} concurrent with prediction curve.

continuousAndDifferentiable.value: f is continuous and differentiable at all points.

continuousAndNotDifferentiable.value: f is continuous but not differentiable at {$numberOfCusps} cusps.

discontinuousAndNotDifferentiable.value: f is not differentiable at {$numberOfDiscontinuities} discontinuities and {$numberOfCusps} cusps.

continuousAndDifferentiable.value: Predict f is continuous and differentiable at all points.

continuousAndNotDifferentiable.value: Predict f is continuous but not differentiable at {$numberOfCusps} cusps.

discontinuousAndNotDifferentiable.value: Predict f is not differentiable at {$numberOfDiscontinuities} discontinuities and {$numberOfCusps} cusps.

continuous.value: Integral curve is continuous and represents definite integral from zero to {$variable} for f of {$variable}.

continuousAndDifferentiable.value: Derivative curve is continuous and differentiable at all points.

discontinuousAndNotDifferentiable.value: Derivative curve is not differentiable at {$numberOfDiscontinuities} discontinuities.

continuousAndDifferentiable.value: Second derivative curve is continuous and differentiable at all points.

discontinuousAndNotDifferentiable.value: Second derivative curve is not differentiable at {$numberOfDiscontinuities} discontinuities.

accessibleHelpText.value: Choose action to take on curve in Primary Graph Area.
Smooth sharp corners and discontinuities on curve in Primary Graph Area.
Reset curve to y equals zero, maintain curve manipulation settings.

primaryCurve.value: f and derived curves reset, settings unchanged.

predictCurve.value: Predict curve reset, other curves and settings unchanged.

accessibleHelpText.value: Undo most recent curve manipulation.

primaryCurve.value: Last manipulation removed from f and derived curves.

predictCurve.value: Last manipulation removed from prediction curve only.

secondDerivative.value: Zoom In Second Derivative y Axis

accessibleHelpText.value: Zoom in y axis only.

secondDerivative.value: Zoom Out Second Derivative y Axis

accessibleHelpText.value: Zoom out y axis only.
Choose curve to manipulate in Primary Graph Area.
Manipulate f curve in Primary Graph Area.
Manipulate prediction curve to predict graph of f based on other graphs.
Choose shape to add to curve in Primary Graph Area.
Add smooth hill to curve.
Add rigid tent shape to curve.
Add pedestal with smooth corners to curve.
Add parabolic shape bounded by horizontal axis to curve.
Add up to 3 and a half periods to curve.
Freely draw curve. Discontinuities likely.
Tilt curve diagonally while pinned at left edge of horizontal axis.
Shift entire curve up or down.
Choose which set of Graph Areas to investigate and find relationships.
Explore Integral at top, Primary at bottom.
Explore Primary at top, Derivative at bottom.

accessibleName.value: Integral, Primary, and Derivative Graph Areas

accessibleHelpText.value: Explore Integral at top, Primary in center, Derivative at bottom.

accessibleName.value: Primary, Derivative, and Second Derivative Graph Areas

accessibleHelpText.value: Explore Primary at top, Derivative in center, Second Derivative at bottom.
Choose variable for horizontal axis.
Label horizontal axis with x.
Label horizontal axis with t.
Choose derivative notation.
Use apostrophes for derivatives.
Show derivative as ratio of change in y with respect to {$variable}.
Choose how to display discontinuities in curves.
Leave gap between discontinuities.
Connect discontinuities with dashed line.
Adjust width of curve manipulation shape. Width ranges from {$min} to {$max} {$variable} axis units.
Adds a mode that allows you to predict f of {$variable}.
Show or hide curve to support predictions.
Manipulate f curve to explore changes to all graphs. Use keyboard shortcuts if needed.
Manipulate curve to predict graph of f based on other curves. Use keyboard shortcuts if needed.

Move vertical line horizontally to change {$variable} value and explore y values on all graphs.
Vertical line passes through all graphs at same {$variable} value.

Move vertical line horizontally to change {$variable} value and explore relationship between
steepness of visible line tangent to f at {$variable}, and y value on derivative curve at same
{$variable} coordinate. Information provides current {$variable} value, slope of line tangent
to f at {$variable}, and value of derivative at {$variable} on derivative curve.

Move vertical line horizontally to change {$variable} value and explore relationship between
cumulative net signed area under f up to current {$variable} value. Shaded area is bounded by
{$variable} axis and f curve. Vertical line passes through all graphs at same {$variable} value.
Information provides current {$variable} value, value of integral up to {$variable}, and
net signed area under f curve.

zero.value: net signed area is zero under f

positive.value: net signed area is positive {$absoluteArea} under f

negative.value: net signed area is negative {$absoluteArea} under f
